text: hi my name is Seth numeric and I play
Albert Narracott in the Lincoln Center
Theater slash national theater
production of warhorse this is a scene
from the play from about the middle of
the play that's me on the right of your
screen and this is a scene where I'm
speaking with Lieutenant James Nichols
who's played by Stephen Plunkett we're
talking about my horse Joey who has just
been sold to fight in the First World
War as part of the British cavalry and
I'm very reluctant to let him go but
major Nichols is convincing me that
he'll he'll take good care of him and
that I don't have anything to worry
about and that's Joey right there as
they're preparing to take him away to
war and on that night it looks like the
role of Joey was played by Jude sandy
Alex Hoefler and Zach via we have three
rotating teams that play Joey on any
given night which is exciting for me it
sort of means that on any night I'm
playing to a different a different
version of Joey it's as if a different
actor were playing the role and there
are different interpretations they
really embody the spirit of a horse and
an animal is spontaneous and is always
in the moment and they capture that very
well and sometimes it's it's even a
little bit frightening and unexpected
but it creates a really exciting
atmosphere for the play and it's a
pleasure to share the stage with them
this is me calling Joey over so that we
can say our goodbyes to each other and
he's about to make his way over to me
right now it's a very heartfelt scene
